metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46341 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because thehandler for the XIPassiveUngrab request accesses out-of-bounds memory wheninvoked with a high keycode or button code. This issue can lead to localprivileges elevation on systems where the X server is running privilegedand remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46341` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xdmx-tools - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xnest - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xorg-server-source - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-common - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xvfb - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7').
xorg-server-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
